subject: Re: Require Help on HTML unit
msgSnippet: Hi, the prefered place for htmlunit related questions is the htmlunit-user mailing list: http://sourceforge.net/mail/?group_id=47038 It seems that your
messageBody:
Hi,

the prefered place for htmlunit related questions is the htmlunit-user
mailing list: http://sourceforge.net/mail/?group_id=47038

It seems that your login.html page contains a meta http-refresh tag that
require a refresh to... login.html. To prevent infinite loops that may
be difficult to understand, htmlunit's default RefreshHandler throw
immediately an exception when it sees a refresh on the same page.
If this refresh is normal for your web application, you can set your own
refresh handler on the WebClient using WebClient.setRefreshHandler.

Marc.

nimamallur wrote:

> {
> try{
> WebClient webClient = new WebClient();
> URL url = new URL("http://127.0.0.1/login.html");
> HtmlPage page = (HtmlPage)webClient.getPage(url);
> System.out.println( "Title :" + page.getTitleTex());
> System.out.println( "Title :" + page.getWebResponse
> ().getContentAsString());
> }catch(Exception e){
> System.out.println("Exception: " + e);
> }
> }
> }
>
> This is the code that i have
>

>

> com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.host.Window
> jsxFunction_setInterval
> WARNING: Current implementation of setInterval does nothing.

> Attempted to refresh a page using an ImmediateRefreshHandler which
> could have caused an OutOfMemoryError Please use
> WaitingRefreshHandler or ThreadedRefreshHandler instead.
